content.description: A cart of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is moving with speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on a smooth track when it encounters a vertical loop of radius <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown above. The cart moves along the inside of the entire loop without leaving the track. All frictional forces are negligible.
content.question: Which of the following must be true for the cart to remain on the track when it is at point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The net force exerted on the cart must be less than the force that the track exerts on the cart.
The net force exerted on the cart must be equal to or greater than the weight of the cart.
The track must exert an upward force on the cart to prevent it from falling.
The track must exert a force on the cart that is equal to the weight of the cart.

content.answer: The net force exerted on the cart must be equal to or greater than the weight of the cart.
